G3739.def: a relative reference to any entity, event, or state, either occurring overtly in the immediate context or clearly implied in the discourse or setting

G4972.def: to use a seal to close or to make something secure

G2250.def: according to Hebrew reckoning (as reflected in the NT), a period of time beginning at sunset and ending at the following sunset

G629.def: to release or set free, with the implied analogy to the process of freeing a slave{N:001}

G575.def: a marker of dissociation, implying a rupture from a former association

G3956.def: the totality of any object, mass, collective, or extension{N:001}

G4088.def: with a bitter taste (occurring only in the idiom χολὴ πικρίας)

G2372.def: a state of intense anger, with the implication of passionate outbursts

G2906.def: the sound of a loud scream or shout

G988.def: to speak against someone in such a way as to harm or injure his or her reputation (occurring in relation to persons as well as to divine beings)

G4862.def: a marker of an associative relation, often involving joint participation in some activity{N:001}

G2549.def: the quality of wickedness, with the implication of that which is harmful and damaging

G1161.def: a marker of an additive relation, but with the possible implication of some contrast

G5543.def: pertaining to being superior for a particular purpose or use

G2155.def: pertaining to being affectionate and compassionate

G5483.def: to give or grant graciously and generously, with the implication of good will on the part of the giver{N:001}

G1438.def: in the singular, a reflexive reference to a person or thing spoken or written about,{N:001} and in the plural, a reflexive reference to any and all persons or things involved as subjects of the clause (including first, second and third persons)

G2531.def: in accordance with a degree as specified by the context

G1722.def: a position defined as being within certain limits{N:001}

G5547.def: (literally: one who has been anointed) in the NT, titles for Jesus as the Messiah, but in many contexts, and especially without an article, Χριστός becomes a part of the name of Jesus; see {D:93.387})

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G2316.def: the one supreme supernatural being as creator and sustainer of the universe
